3/18/22, 12:52 AM TIME Asia Pacific health and finance ministers stress importance of universal health coverage in COVID-19 era and beyond Western Pacific Asia Pacific health and finance ministers stress importance of universal health coverage in COVID-19 era and beyond 17 September 2020 | Media release | MANILA GPE , PHILIPPINES GPE Health and finance ministers from across Asia LOC and the Pacific LOC stressed the importance of universal health coverage ( UHC ORG ) and the need for stronger collaboration to mobilize financing for health care during today DATE ’s Joint Ministers of Finance and Health Symposium on Universal Health Coverage in Asia LOC and the Pacific LOC : COVID-19 PERSON and Beyond ORG .

Speaking during the opening of the symposium, the World Health Organization ORG (WHO) Regional Director for the Western Pacific ORG , Dr Takeshi Kasai PERSON , made the case for continued investments in universal health coverage.

“We have long known about the link between good health and the economy, but COVID-19 PERSON has exposed current weaknesses and gaps in our health systems – making the task of reform even more urgent,” he said.
https://www.who.int/westernpacific/news/item/17-09-2020-asia-pacific-health-and-finance-ministers-stress-importance-of-universal-health-coverage-in-… 1/2 CARDINAL 3/18/22 PRODUCT , 12:52 AM TIME Asia Pacific health and finance ministers stress importance of universal health coverage in COVID-19 era and beyond Organized by the WHO ORG regional offices for South-East Asia LOC and the Western Pacific LOC , the Asian Development Bank ORG (ADB) and the Government of Japan GPE , the symposium brought together health and finance leaders, international organizations, civil society and other partners to catalyse concrete actions that build on UHC ORG commitments made at the G20 ORG meeting in Osaka GPE in June 2019 DATE and at the United Nations ORG High-level Meeting on UHC ORG in New York GPE in September 2019 DATE .

At today DATE ’s virtual symposium, ministers of finance and ministers of health from Fiji GPE , Indonesia GPE , the Republic of Korea GPE , the Philippines GPE , Sri Lanka GPE and Viet Nam GPE shared strategies and lessons from navigating the coronavirus disease 2019 DATE (COVID-19) pandemic.

This included discussing the role of UHC ORG in increasing resilience to health and economic shocks, and how investing in health can drive economic recovery given their strong interlinkage.

Over the past decade DATE , countries in the WHO Western Pacific Region have made significant health gains and increased commitments towards UHC ORG .
But in some countries of the Region, up to PERCENT 60% PERCENT of people still lack coverage with essential health services, and more than 1 CARDINAL in 5 CARDINAL households spend over 10% PERCENT of their income on health care.

Accelerating progress towards UHC ORG is foundational to making the Western Pacific LOC the safest and healthiest region, as outlined in For the Future ORG , WHO’s vision for its work with Member States and partners in the Region in the coming years DATE .

ADB President Masatsugu Asakawa PERSON affirmed ADB’s support for UHC ORG as a foundation of strong health systems.

“We have to build health systems where people from all walks of life, including the elderly, the poor and the vulnerable, can access health services at an affordable cost while maintaining their financial sustainability—even in aging societies that many countries in Asia LOC and the Pacific LOC are heading toward,” he said.
